answers.answer: Hi, I am not an expert but did you have any tests besides that you have the virus?Your doctor (don't know if you have one at this time) could run a lot of different test - most importantly a full blood series to find out more.Please find a specialist - don't delay as feeling sick is not normal - for sure you want to know if it is related to HCV or something else.Hope you get some answers.LLN

Is your illness a result of anxiety, perhaps? HCV generally takes decades to progress; you’re really not any more ill than you were a month ago before you were diagnosed. Of course, you might have picked up a flu or other seasonal illness, but it’s unlikely at this time of year.Have you called your doctor and discussed this with him?Welcome to the discussion group,Bill
Thank you Bill. I will get results from biopsy back this week. I have appt. with doctor on wednesday as I might have diabetes also. Maybe the reason for my stomach sick daily. Thank you

question: Hello Everyone, I was hoping to ask a question. I was diagnosed about 30 days ago and wanted to know if it is normal to be nausious all of the time. Thank You
title: Nausiated with Hep C
